<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/electric-vehicle-stocks-lucid-and-rivian-soar-as-investors-seek-out-the-next-tesla?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Honk if You're an EV Stock
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/electric-vehicle-stocks-lucid-and-rivian-soar-as-investors-seek-out-the-next-tesla?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Rivian vehicle charging, with its stock ticker in the background " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4b4dee4da5912b3e15e8783dd000222919e38e49-1500x1000.gif?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mickey McDougall; Rivian</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s a new silent killer on Wall Street: electric vehicle stocks <em>not </em>named Tesla.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since going public last week, Rivian has more than <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-16/rivian-whizzes-past-volkswagen-s-valuation-as-ev-mania-rages?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doubled in value</a> after gaining another 15% yesterday. With a $146.7 billion market cap, it’s now the third-most valuable automaker in the world behind Tesla and Toyota, since it zoomed by Volkswagen yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Quick stat check:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Rivian has no material revenue and delivered a total of 156 of its electric pickup trucks by the end of October.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Volkswagen delivers 10 million vehicles per year, generating annual revenues of around $300 billion.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But let’s not pick on VW—Rivian is also more valuable than nearly 90% of S&P 500 companies, including Starbucks, Boeing, and Goldman Sachs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And then there’s <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/16/lucid-ceo-says-the-company-could-eventually-be-valued-like-tesla.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lucid Motors</a>. This EV startup, which is run by a former Tesla exec, surged nearly 24% yesterday after the company reported its first quarterly earnings since SPAC-ing in July.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s Lucid’s deal?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Its first model, the Lucid Air, just won MotorTrend’s 2022 Car of the Year award. The Air has a range of 520 miles—the industry’s best.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Compared to Rivian, Lucid is a revenue-generating machine, bringing in $232,000 in sales in Q3. With a market cap of $89.9 billion, it’s worth more than Ford.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Does any of this make sense?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some analysts warn this surge of EV stocks with minuscule revenue is a sign of “froth” in the market. These companies <em>are </em>very popular with individual traders: Tesla, Rivian, and Lucid were at the top of Fidelity’s list of most bought assets yesterday, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-16/rivian-whizzes-past-volkswagen-s-valuation-as-ev-mania-rages?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg reports</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thing is, no one wants to miss out on the next Tesla. Musk’s EV company soared to a market cap of $1 trillion last month as enthusiasm over the auto industry’s electric pivot reached new heights.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It could go even higher.</strong> The new infrastructure bill devotes $7.5 billion to building a nationwide EV charging network, and a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-16/the-electric-vehicle-invasion-is-already-here-kw257rxq?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new BloombergNEF report</a> showed that drivers will buy 5.6 million electric cars globally this year, double the number bought last year and representing almost 8% of all vehicles sold.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/us-consumers-are-alive-well-and-spending-despite-inflation-concerns?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Live Look at the US Consumer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/us-consumers-are-alive-well-and-spending-despite-inflation-concerns?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Arnold flexing " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-16/image-41f14376536cec584b0382f561aa9481dbaeda2f-320x240-gif/giphy(12).gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Arnold flexing " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-16/image-41f14376536cec584b0382f561aa9481dbaeda2f-320x240-gif/giphy(12).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US retail sales <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-economy-october-2021-retail-sales-11637009365?mod=hp_lead_pos1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose</a> by a more-than-expected 1.7% in October from the previous month, showing that shoppers are burying any inflation worries under a pile of electronics, groceries, and new cars.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Online retailers saw a huge 4% uptick in sales, which perhaps is evidence that shoppers are frontloading holiday gifts to get ahead of potential shipping delays (that’s so considerate of you, mom).</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Meanwhile, earnings reports from major retailers also presented a rosy view of the shopping landscape.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Walmart </strong></span><span>said more customers are shopping in its stores, and that its size has allowed it to blunt price increases. (“Fighting inflation is in our DNA,” CEO Doug McMillon boasted.) The company shelves should be stocked for the holiday shopping season, with inventory growing 11.5% last quarter.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Home Depot </strong></span><span>also </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/home-depot-beats-sales-estimates-sustained-home-improvement-demand-2021-11-16/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cruised</a></span><span> past expectations. It seems the home improvement boom is chugging along as if we were all still in lockdown.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>All this bullish retail news arrives as consumer confidence fell to its lowest level in a decade this month. Maybe perception isn’t reality.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><strong style="color:#000">+ For more retail news...</strong>yep, we have a newsletter for that. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=inline&utm_campaign=link&email={email}&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up for Retail Brew here</a>.—NF</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/regulators-investigate-teens-favorite-e-cigarette-brand-puff-bar?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Smoke, Still Under Fire
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Regulators are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/puff-bar-e-cigarette-maker-under-investigation-by-north-carolina-attorney-general-11637081589?mod=hp_lista_pos5" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bearing down</a> on teens’ favorite e-cigarette brand: Puff Bar. It’s about to be investigated by North Carolina’s attorney general, per the WSJ, its second probe after a House oversight committee announced its own last week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s what you need to know about the brand that’s usurped Juul as the vape of choice in high-school bathrooms:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Like old school Juuls, Puff Bars come in candy-esque flavors such as Blue Razz and Peach Ice. But unlike Juul, Puff Bar uses </span><span><em>synthetic</em></span><span> nicotine...which isn’t derived from tobacco. Because of that, its products don’t fall under the FDA’s jurisdiction.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That’s very intentional. Puff Bar paused sales last July after regulators started snooping around. And after an internal shake-up that resulted in 27-year-olds Patrick Beltran and Nick Minas becoming co-CEOs, reformulated its e-cigs to be tobacco-free before relaunching this year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">By selling synthetic nicotine devices, Puff Bar has so far <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-27-year-old-friends-behind-puff-barteens-favorite-e-cigarette-11633978700?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">escaped the rules</a> that forced Juul and other e-cigarette brands to nix the fruity flavors that made them popular. Now the FDA is looking into whether it can bring synthetic nicotine under its regulatory umbrella, too.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Vaping among middle- and high-schoolers <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/key-performance-indicators-october-1?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped ~40%</a> from last year, which itself was a big drop from 2019. But the FDA still considers youth vaping an “<a href="https://www.fda.gov/news-events/congressional-testimony/epidemic-continues-youth-vaping-america-06232021?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">epidemic</a>,” and usage could bounce back now that teens are out of Zoom school and back to regular school.—<em>JW</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/key-performance-indicators-november-17?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/key-performance-indicators-november-17?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Still from the movie Red Notice" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/0fa1e16d0d32f0e3a33a76384446ffb65c3f0c47-1200x500.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Netflix subscribers spent nearly 149 million hours watching its new flick, <em>Red Notice</em>, last week, making it the most popular piece of English-language content on the platform...by far. We only know this thanks to a <a href="https://top10.netflix.com/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new tracking website</a> the company rolled out in an attempt to be more transparent about its data.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “We will not be silenced until Bobby Kotick has been replaced as CEO.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">ABK Workers Alliance, a group of Activision Blizzard employees trying to unionize, staged a walkout in their efforts to oust the video game company’s boss. Activision Blizzard has come under scrutiny this year over its “frat boy culture” and alleged sexual harassment against female employees. Yesterday, the WSJ released a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/activision-videogames-bobby-kotick-sexual-misconduct-allegations-11637075680?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> saying Kotick himself shielded abusers and harassed an assistant.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> Warehouse workers explain why they joined the Great Resignation. (<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/millions-of-americans-tell-their-bosses-i-quit?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Morning Brew</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/the-packers-are-selling-stock-for-the-sixth-time-in-team-history?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Part Cheese, Part Owner
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/16/the-packers-are-selling-stock-for-the-sixth-time-in-team-history?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A dog wearing a Packers jersey and a cheesehead sits outside of Lambeau field" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ab793f6dfbf497b84b492d13ff4e2c8563e79235-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jonathan Daniel/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Don’t let anyone tell you that you can’t be an NFL owner just because you “aren’t extraordinarily wealthy” or “don’t have a relative who already owns an NFL team.” You <em>can</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Green Bay Packers started offering up <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/you-can-buy-stock-in-the-green-bay-packers-for-just-300-11637034413?mod=hp_lead_pos13" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shares of “ownership”</a> in the team for the first time in 10 years—and the sixth time in team history—on Tuesday. Through Feb. 25, the franchise will sell 300,000 of the shares for $300 apiece.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unlike big, serious stocks such as Amazon or GameStop, Packers stock comes with a few caveats. These shares have no financial value, they don’t appreciate or pay dividends, and they cannot be transferred (except by gift to family members or through inheritance). But: You <em>do</em> get a certificate, an invitation to the annual shareholders’ meeting, and the ability to tweet any thoughts you have about the receiving corps to coach Matt LaFleur (not exclusive to shareholders).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Packers are the league’s sole publicly owned team and previously offered team stock in 1923, 1935, 1950, 1997, and 2011—amassing 361,362 shareholders in the process. The $67.4 million raised in 2011 contributed to a new entrance tower and viewing platform, which added about 6,600 seats to Lambeau Field.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHonk if You're an EV Stock \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Rivian vehicle charging, with its stock ticker in the background \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4b4dee4da5912b3e15e8783dd000222919e38e49-1500x1000.gif?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMickey McDougall; Rivian\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere’s a new silent killer on Wall Street: electric vehicle stocks \u003cem\u003enot \u003c/em\u003enamed Tesla.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince going public last week, Rivian has more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-16/rivian-whizzes-past-volkswagen-s-valuation-as-ev-mania-rages?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoubled in value\u003c/a\u003e after gaining another 15% yesterday. With a $146.7 billion market cap, it’s now the third-most valuable automaker in the world behind Tesla and Toyota, since it zoomed by Volkswagen yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQuick stat check:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRivian has no material revenue and delivered a total of 156 of its electric pickup trucks by the end of October.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eVolkswagen delivers 10 million vehicles per year, generating annual revenues of around $300 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut let’s not pick on VW—Rivian is also more valuable than nearly 90% of S\u0026P 500 companies, including Starbucks, Boeing, and Goldman Sachs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd then there’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/16/lucid-ceo-says-the-company-could-eventually-be-valued-like-tesla.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLucid Motors\u003c/a\u003e. This EV startup, which is run by a former Tesla exec, surged nearly 24% yesterday after the company reported its first quarterly earnings since SPAC-ing in July.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat’s Lucid’s deal?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIts first model, the Lucid Air, just won MotorTrend’s 2022 Car of the Year award. The Air has a range of 520 miles—the industry’s best.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCompared to Rivian, Lucid is a revenue-generating machine, bringing in $232,000 in sales in Q3. With a market cap of $89.9 billion, it’s worth more than Ford.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eDoes any of this make sense?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome analysts warn this surge of EV stocks with minuscule revenue is a sign of “froth” in the market. These companies \u003cem\u003eare \u003c/em\u003every popular with individual traders: Tesla, Rivian, and Lucid were at the top of Fidelity’s list of most bought assets yesterday, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-16/rivian-whizzes-past-volkswagen-s-valuation-as-ev-mania-rages?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBloomberg reports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThing is, no one wants to miss out on the next Tesla. Musk’s EV company soared to a market cap of $1 trillion last month as enthusiasm over the auto industry’s electric pivot reached new heights.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt could go even higher.\u003c/strong\u003e The new infrastructure bill devotes $7.5 billion to building a nationwide EV charging network, and a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-16/the-electric-vehicle-invasion-is-already-here-kw257rxq?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew BloombergNEF report\u003c/a\u003e showed that drivers will buy 5.6 million electric cars globally this year, double the number bought last year and representing almost 8% of all vehicles sold.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUS retail sales \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/us-economy-october-2021-retail-sales-11637009365?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose\u003c/a\u003e by a more-than-expected 1.7% in October from the previous month, showing that shoppers are burying any inflation worries under a pile of electronics, groceries, and new cars.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOnline retailers saw a huge 4% uptick in sales, which perhaps is evidence that shoppers are frontloading holiday gifts to get ahead of potential shipping delays (that’s so considerate of you, mom).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMeanwhile, earnings reports from major retailers also presented a rosy view of the shopping landscape.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWalmart \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003esaid more customers are shopping in its stores, and that its size has allowed it to blunt price increases. (“Fighting inflation is in our DNA,” CEO Doug McMillon boasted.) The company shelves should be stocked for the holiday shopping season, with inventory growing 11.5% last quarter.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHome Depot \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ealso \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/home-depot-beats-sales-estimates-sustained-home-improvement-demand-2021-11-16/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecruised\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e past expectations. It seems the home improvement boom is chugging along as if we were all still in lockdown.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAll this bullish retail news arrives as consumer confidence fell to its lowest level in a decade this month. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nNo Smoke, Still Under Fire\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRegulators are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/puff-bar-e-cigarette-maker-under-investigation-by-north-carolina-attorney-general-11637081589?mod=hp_lista_pos5\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebearing down\u003c/a\u003e on teens’ favorite e-cigarette brand: Puff Bar. It’s about to be investigated by North Carolina’s attorney general, per the WSJ, its second probe after a House oversight committee announced its own last week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere’s what you need to know about the brand that’s usurped Juul as the vape of choice in high-school bathrooms:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLike old school Juuls, Puff Bars come in candy-esque flavors such as Blue Razz and Peach Ice. But unlike Juul, Puff Bar uses \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003esynthetic\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e nicotine...which isn’t derived from tobacco. Because of that, its products don’t fall under the FDA’s jurisdiction.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat’s very intentional. Puff Bar paused sales last July after regulators started snooping around. And after an internal shake-up that resulted in 27-year-olds Patrick Beltran and Nick Minas becoming co-CEOs, reformulated its e-cigs to be tobacco-free before relaunching this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBy selling synthetic nicotine devices, Puff Bar has so far \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-27-year-old-friends-behind-puff-barteens-favorite-e-cigarette-11633978700?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eescaped the rules\u003c/a\u003e that forced Juul and other e-cigarette brands to nix the fruity flavors that made them popular. Now the FDA is looking into whether it can bring synthetic nicotine under its regulatory umbrella, too.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Vaping among middle- and high-schoolers \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/30/key-performance-indicators-october-1?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped ~40%\u003c/a\u003e from last year, which itself was a big drop from 2019. But the FDA still considers youth vaping an “\u003ca href=\"https://www.fda.gov/news-events/congressional-testimony/epidemic-continues-youth-vaping-america-06232021?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eepidemic\u003c/a\u003e,” and usage could bounce back now that teens are out of Zoom school and back to regular school.—\u003cem\u003eJW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/you-can-buy-stock-in-the-green-bay-packers-for-just-300-11637034413?mod=hp_lead_pos13\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshares of “ownership”\u003c/a\u003e in the team for the first time in 10 years—and the sixth time in team history—on Tuesday. Through Feb. 25, the franchise will sell 300,000 of the shares for $300 apiece.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnlike big, serious stocks such as Amazon or GameStop, Packers stock comes with a few caveats. These shares have no financial value, they don’t appreciate or pay dividends, and they cannot be transferred (except by gift to family members or through inheritance). But: You \u003cem\u003edo\u003c/em\u003e get a certificate, an invitation to the annual shareholders’ meeting, and the ability to tweet any thoughts you have about the receiving corps to coach Matt LaFleur (not exclusive to shareholders).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Packers are the league’s sole publicly owned team and previously offered team stock in 1923, 1935, 1950, 1997, and 2011—amassing 361,362 shareholders in the process. The $67.4 million raised in 2011 contributed to a new entrance tower and viewing platform, which added about 6,600 seats to Lambeau
